name: Engineering Statics

timeGuidelines.description: The standard instructional time for the day-time course offering is 60 hours. Continuing Education and Distance Education hours will vary.

description: This course covers components and resultants of vectors, two-force members, free-body diagrams, equations of equilibrium, equilibrium of concurrent force systems and pulley systems, moments and couples, equilibrium of non concurrent force systems, truss analysis using method of joints and method of sections, and frame analysis using method of members.

courseDescription.overview: This course covers components and resultants of vectors, two-force members, free-body diagrams, equations of equilibrium, equilibrium of concurrent force systems and pulley systems, moments and couples, equilibrium of non concurrent force systems, truss analysis using method of joints and method of sections, and frame analysis using method of members.
courseDescription.timeGuidelines: The standard instructional time for the day-time course offering is 60 hours. Continuing Education and Distance Education hours will vary.

learningOutcomes.title: Submit a problem solution complete in all aspects of organized layout, calculations, units, and significant digits
objectives: Explain the components of applied mechanics
Use the system of SI units in the solution of engineering problems
Submit problem solutions in a clear and organized layout
Prepare problem solutions with appropriate numerical accuracy and significant figures
Use the basic principles of Algebra, Geometry, and Trigonometry to solve introductory problems

learningOutcomes.title: Determine the resultant of several vectors
objectives: Define the properties of vectors
Classify types, characteristics, and units of forces
Calculate the resultant of two perpendicular forces
Perform vector addition by using the graphical method (Tail to Tip)
Perform vector addition by using the Sine and Cosine Laws
Resolve vectors into components
Perform vector addition by using the component method

learningOutcomes.title: Calculate moments and couples
objectives: Calculate the moment of a force about a point
Calculate the moment due to a couple
Calculate the net moment about a point

learningOutcomes.title: Apply three equations of equilibrium to coplanar force systems
objectives: Draw free-body diagrams using common conventions
State the three equations of equilibrium
Analyze pulley systems
Identify two-force members
Determine member forces in coplanar concurrent force systems
Calculate support reactions in coplanar parallel force systems
Calculate support reactions in coplanar nonconcurrent force systems

learningOutcomes.title: Solve problems involving the method of joints, method of members, and method of sections
objectives: Determine forces in truss members using the method of joints
Determine forces in truss members using the method of sections
Calculate pin and support reactions using the method of members
